      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Point3D add(Point3D gps, Point3D vector)
      computes a new point which is the gps point transformed by a 3D vector (in meters).
      double[] azimuth_elevation_dist(Point3D gps0, Point3D gps1)
      computes the polar representation of the 3D vector be gps0-->gps1.
      double distance3d(Point3D gps0, Point3D gps1)
      computes the 3D distance (in meters) between the two gps like points, using the vector3D function.
      boolean isValid_GPS_Point(Point3D p)
      return true iff this point is a valid lat, lon , lat coordinate: [-180,+180],[-90,+90],[-450, +inf]
      Point3D vector3D(Point3D gps0, Point3D gps1)
      computes the 3D vector (in meters) between two gps like points.

      • azimuth_elevation_dist

        public double[] azimuth_elevation_dist(Point3D gps0,
                                       Point3D gps1)
        computes the polar representation of the 3D vector be gps0-->gps1. for this function, we used the formulas in this website http://tchester.org/sgm/analysis/peaks/how_to_get_view_params.html
        Specified by:
        azimuth_elevation_dist in interface coords_converter
        Parameters:
        gps0, - gps 1 - the two points.
        Returns:
        an array of asimuth, elevation, distcance (in this order).

      • isValid_GPS_Point

        public boolean isValid_GPS_Point(Point3D p)
        Description copied from interface: coords_converter
        return true iff this point is a valid lat, lon , lat coordinate: [-180,+180],[-90,+90],[-450, +inf]
        Specified by:
        isValid_GPS_Point in interface coords_converter
        Parameters:
        p - the point
        Returns:
        true if this point is a valid lat, lon , lat coordinate.
